description:
Setting this to Allow will generate a 48-digit recovery password during BitLocker initialization and send it to Azure AD if policy Save BitLocker recovery information to Azure Active Directory is set to enable. Admin users will be allowed to create new recovery passwords manually.
Setting this to Require will generate a 48-digit recovery password during BitLocker initialization and send it to Azure AD if policy Save BitLocker recovery information to Azure Active Directory is set to enable. Admin users will be allowed to create new recovery passwords manually.
Setting this to Deny will stop BitLocker initialization from creating a recovery password and sending it to Azure AD, and will disallow users from generating new recovery passwords manually.

BitLocker silent enablement requires this setting configured as Allow or Require.
